SUBJECT: Notice Of Shareholders Meetings-XBRL
DETAILS: ASIAN PAINTS LIMITED has informed the Exchange about Notice of Shareholders Meeting for Postal Ballot

SUBJECT: Shareholders meeting
DETAILS: We invite your attention to our letter no. APL/SEC/32/2023-24/53 dated 26th October 2023, wherein it was informed that the Board of Directors of the Company had, inter alia, approved the appointment of Mr. Soumitra Bhattacharya (DIN:02783243) as an Additional Director in Independent capacity to hold office for a period of five consecutive years from 26th October 2023 to 25th October 2028, subject to approval of the shareholders of the Company through Postal Ballot.In this regards, please find enclosed the Notice of Postal Ballot ( Notice ) together with theExplanatory Statement being sent to the members of the Company.In compliance with the provisions of the General Circular No. 09/2023 dated 25th September 2023 and other relevant Circulars issued by the Ministry of Corporate Affairs from time to time, this Notice is being sent only through electronic mode to all the members whose e-mail addresses are registered with the Company/Depositories and whose names appear in the Register of Members of the Company or Register of Beneficial Owners maintained by the Depositories as on Friday, 17th November 2023 ( Cut-off date ).The members whose e-mail address is not registered with the Company/Depositories, to receive the Notice, may register their e-mail address with TSR Consultants Private Limited, Registrar and Share Transfer Agent of the Company in the manner as provided in the enclosed Notice.The Company has engaged the services of National Securities Depository Limited ( NSDL ) toprovide remote e-voting facility to its members. The remote e-voting period commences onThursday, 23rd November 2023 from 9.00 a.m. (IST) and ends on Friday, 22nd December 2023at 5.00 p.m. (IST). The remote e-voting module shall be disabled by NSDL thereafter.The results of the Postal Ballot will be announced on or before 5.00 p.m. IST on Wednesday,27th December 2023.The Notice is also being made available on the website of the Company at www.asianpaints.com and on the website of NSDL at www.evoting.nsdl.com.This is for your information and record.

SUBJECT: Dividend Updates
DETAILS: The Board of Directors at their meeting held today i.e., Thursday, 26th October 2023, have, inter alia, approved the Payment of interim dividend of Rs. 5.15 (Rupees five and paise fifteen only) per equity share of the face value of Re. 1 (Rupee One) each for the financial year ending 31st March 2024. SUBJECT: Change in Management
DETAILS: This is with reference to our letter no. APL/SEC/19/2021-22/21 dated 23rd June, 2021, wherein the Company had informed you of the appointment of Mr. Deepak Satwalekar (DIN: 00009627), Independent Director, as the Chairman of the Company and the Board of Directors, upto the conclusion of his term of appointment on 30th September, 2023. Considering the impending retirement of Mr. Deepak Satwalekar as an Independent Director of the Company, the Board of Directors at their meeting held today i.e. Tuesday, 25th July, 2023, have appointed Mr. R. Seshasayee (DIN: 00047985), Independent Director, as the Chairman of the Board and the Company with effect from 1st October, 2023 upto the conclusion of his term of appointment on 22nd January, 2027. The brief profile of Mr. R. Seshasayee is enclosed. The Board meeting commenced at 10:00 a.m. (IST) and concluded at 2:32 p.m. (IST).

SUBJECT: Updates
DETAILS: This is in continuation to our letter nos. APL/SEC/32/2022-23/46 dated 20th October, 2022 and APL/SEC/32/2023-24/4 dated 4th May, 2023, wherein you were, inter alia, informed of the proposal of the Company of carrying out the business of manufacturing and exporting white cement and white cement clinker. It was also informed that the Company had set up a joint venture company, Asian White Cement Holding Limited (AWCHL) in Dubai International Financial Centre, United Arab Emirates (UAE) as the holding company for the purpose of setting up an operating company in Fujairah, UAE. It is now informed that a wholly owned subsidiary of AWCHL has been  incorporated in the name of  Asian White Inc. FZE  in Fujairah Free Zone, UAE on 26th June, 2023 for the purpose of carrying out the business of manufacturing, trading and exporting white cement. The Trade License and Certificate of Incorporation for Asian White Inc. FZE issued by Government of Fujairah, Fujairah Free Zone Authority, has been received by AWCHL on 4th July, 2023.None of the related parties of the Company, including the Director(s) and/or Key Managerial Personnel of the Company are concerned or interested in this transaction.You are requested to kindly take the above information on record

SUBJECT: Acquisition
DETAILS: This is to inform you that the Company has, today, acquired further 11% of the equity share capital of Obgenix Software Private Limited (hereinafter referred by its brand name  White Teak ) for a consideration of Rs. 54 crores (approx.) from Mr. Pawan Mehta, Mr. Gagan Mehta (hereinafter referred to as  promoters of White Teak ). The Company now holds 60% of equity share capital of White Teak, by virtue of which White Teak has become a subsidiary of the Company. Additionally, as informed in the previous intimations in this regard and in terms of the Share Purchase Agreement and other definitive documents, an earn out amount of Rs. 59.5 crores (approx.), based on achievement of mutually agreed financial milestones, has also been paid to the promoters of White Teak.

DETAILS: The Board of Directors at their meeting held today have, inter alia, recommended payment of final dividend of Rs. 21.25 per equity share of the face value of Re. 1 each for the financial year ended 31st March, 2023, subject to approval of the shareholders at the ensuing 77th Annual General Meeting of the Company. The Company has fixed Friday, 9th June, 2023 as the Record Date for determining entitlement of members to final dividend for the financial year ended 31st March, 2023. The dividend, if approved by the shareholders will be paid on or after Friday, 30th June, 2023.

SUBJECT: Date of payment of dividend
DETAILS: Asian Paints Limited has informed the Exchange about Date of payment of dividend

SUBJECT: Dividend
DETAILS: Asian Paints Limited has informed the Exchange that Board of Directors at its meeting held on May 11, 2023, recommended Final Dividend of 21.25 per equity share.

SUBJECT: Financial Result Updates
DETAILS: Asian Paints Limited has submitted to the Exchange, the financial results for the period ended March 31, 2023.

SUBJECT: Outcome of Board Meeting
DETAILS: The Board of Directors at their meeting held today have, inter alia, approved the following: 1.ￂﾠAudited standalone and consolidated financial results for the quarter and financial year ended 31st March, 2023.2.ￂﾠAudited standalone and consolidated financial statements for the financial year ended 31st March, 2023. 3.ￂﾠRecommended payment of final dividend of Rs. 21.25 per equity share of the face value of Re. 1 each for the financial year ended 31st March, 2023, subject to approval of the shareholders at the ensuing 77th Annual General Meeting of the Company.4.The Company has fixed Friday, 9th June, 2023 as the Record Date for determining entitlement of members to final dividend for the financial year ended 31st March, 2023. The dividend, if approved by the shareholders will be paid on or after Friday, 30th June, 2023. 5.ￂﾠConvening of 77th AGM of the Company on Tuesday, 27th June, 2023, at 11:00 a.m. IST through video conference or other audio-visual means.

SUBJECT: Incorporation-XBRL
DETAILS: This is in continuation to our letter no. APL/SEC/32/2022-23/46 dated 20th October, 2022. This is to further inform that a joint venture company by the name of Asian White Cement Holding Limited has been incorporated in Dubai International Financial Centre, UAE on 2nd May, 2023 as the holding company for the purpose of setting up an operating company in Fujairah, UAE. The authorised share capital of the Asian White Cement Holding Limited is AED 60 millionￂﾠ(Rs. 133.67 crores) divided into 6 million equity shares of face value of AED 10 each. The Trade License and Certificate of Incorporation for Asian White Cement Holding Limited issued by Dubai International Financial Centre, Registrar of Companies, has been received by the Company onￂﾠ3rd May, 2023.

SUBJECT: Updates
DETAILS: Asian Paints Limited has informed the Exchange regarding 'This is with reference to our earlier letter nos. APL/SEC/32/2022-23/45, APL/SEC/32/2022-23/54 and APL/SEC/32/2022-23/65 dated 20th October, 2022, 16th November, 2022, and 12th January,2023, respectively, on the captioned subject.This is to inform you that Asian Paints (Polymers) Private Limited, wholly owned subsidiary of theCompany, has, today, entered into a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) with the Governmentof Gujarat to set up the manufacturing facility for Vinyl Acetate Ethylene Emulsion (VAE) and VinylAcetate Monomer (VAM) at Dahej, Gujarat, subject to such approvals and clearances, as may berequired.The Company will make necessary disclosures on any material developments in this regard from time to time.'.

SUBJECT: Updates
DETAILS: Asian Paints Limited has informed the Exchange regarding 'This is in continuation to our letter nos. APL/SEC/32/2022-23/45 and APL/SEC/32/2022-23/54 dated 20th October, 2022 and 16th November, 2022, respectively, wherein it was, inter alia, informed that the Company would be setting up a manufacturing facility for Vinyl Acetate Ethylene Emulsion (VAE) and Vinyl Acetate Monomer (VAM) in India. It is now informed that a wholly owned subsidiary of the Company, by the name of  Asian Paints (Polymers) Private Limited  has been incorporated yesterday, 11th January, 2023, for the aforesaid purpose with an authorised share capital of Rs. 100 crores. The Company will make necessary disclosures on any material developments in this regard. This is for your information and record.'.

SUBJECT: Updates
DETAILS: Asian Paints Limited has informed the Exchange regarding 'This is to inform you that the Board of Directors of the Company at their meeting held on 6th January, 2023 have accorded their approval for setting up a new water-based paint manufacturing facility with a capacity of 4 lakhs kilolitres per annum at an approximate investment of Rs. 2,000 crores. The manufacturing at the facility is expected to be commissioned in 3 years, after acquisition of land. The Company is exploring the possibility of making this investment and setting up the manufacturing facility in the state of Madhya Pradesh, subject to grant of requisite incentives by the Government of Madhya Pradesh and such other approvals and clearances, as may be required.The Company would use latest manufacturing technology to produce paints and intermediates in the proposed manufacturing facility in an environment friendly manner.The Company will make necessary disclosures on material developments in this regard. This is for your information and record.'.

SUBJECT: General updates
DETAILS: This is with reference to our letter no. APL/SEC/32/2022-23/45 dated 20th October, 2022, wherein it was informed that the Company would be setting up a manufacturing facility for Vinyl Acetate Ethylene Emulsion (VAE) and Vinyl Acetate Monomer (VAM) in India. The setting up of facility for manufacture of VAM would be based on licensed technology tie up with Kellogg Brown & Root LLC (KBR), USA. KBR is a USD 7.3 Bn company based at USA and has presence in 80+ countries.  It is now informed that the Company has entered into technology and other allied agreements with KBR for manufacturing of VAM in India. The Company will make necessary disclosures on any further material developments in this regard. This is for your information and record.

SUBJECT: Press Release
DETAILS: This is to inform you that, the Company has, today, entered into a binding term sheet for the setting up of a joint venture in Fujairah, United Arab Emirates (UAE), with Riddhi Siddhi Crusher & Land Transport (Riddhi Siddhi), Fujairah, UAE, Associated Soap Stone Distributing Company Private Limited (ASD), India and others (collectively referred to as ￢ﾀﾘthe Parties￢ﾀﾙ). The proposed joint venture would be set up with 60:40 partnership between the Company and the Parties and would carry out the business of manufacturing and exporting white cement and white cement clinker. Please find attached a Press Release on the subject.

SUBJECT: Agreements/Contracts/Arrangements/ MOU's PARA B
DETAILS: This is to inform you that, the Company has, today, entered into a binding term sheet for the setting up of a joint venture in Fujairah, United Arab Emirates (UAE), with Riddhi Siddhi Crusher & Land Transport (Riddhi Siddhi), Fujairah, UAE, Associated Soap Stone Distributing Company Private Limited (ASD), India and others (collectively referred to as ￢ﾀﾘthe Parties￢ﾀﾙ). The proposed joint venture would be set up with 60:40 partnership between the Company and the Parties and would carry out the business of manufacturing and exporting white cement and white cement clinker. Please find attached a Press Release on the subject.The Company will be holding a conference call with the investors at 5 pm (IST) today, wherein the management will brief on the same. The details of the said conference call are available on the Company's website (www.asianpaints.com). This is for your information and record.

SUBJECT: Dividend
DETAILS: Asian Paints Limited has informed the Exchange that Board of Directors at its meeting held on 20-Oct-2022, declared Dividend of Rs. 4.40 per equity share.

SUBJECT: Outcome of Board Meeting
DETAILS: The Board of Directors at their meeting held today have, inter alia, approved the following:(a)    Audited standalone and unaudited consolidated financial results of the Company for the quarter and half year ended 30th September, 2022; and(b)    Payment of interim dividend of Rs. 4.40 (Rupees four and paise forty only) per equity share of the face value of Re. 1 (Rupee One) each for the financial year ending 31st March, 2023. Record date for the purpose of determining the entitlement of the shareholders for interim dividend has been fixed as Tuesday, 1st November, 2022, and dividend will be paid to the shareholders on or after Thursday, 10th November, 2022.Accordingly, the financial results along with the Press Release is enclosed.The Board meeting commenced at 11.00 a.m. (IST) and will continue till the scheduled time.

SUBJECT: Litigations/Disputes/Regulatory actions
DETAILS: This is with reference to our earlier letter no. APL/SEC/15/569 dated 15 Jan, 2020 wherein the Company had informed that the Hon￢ﾀﾙble Competition Commission of India (Commission) had passed a prima facie Order dated 14 Jan, 2020 directing the Director General to cause investigation against the Company, under the provisions of Section 26(1) of the Competition Act, 2002 (Act), basis information received from JSW Paints Private Limited. We wish to inform the following: 1. The Director General, pursuant to the directions of the Hon￢ﾀﾙble Commission, investigated the matter and had submitted its Investigation Report; 2. The Commission heard both the parties at length on the Investigation Report and passed its Order dated 8 Sep, 2022; 3. In pursuance to the said Order, the Commission has noted that no case of contravention of provisions of Section 4 and Section 3(4) read with Section 3(1) of the Act is made out in the present case. This Order is available on the website of CCI

SUBJECT: Acquisition
DETAILS: This is in continuation to our letter dated 1st April, 2022, wherein it was, inter alia, informed that the Company has entered into a Shareholders Agreement and Share Subscription Agreement with the promoters of Weatherseal Fenestration Private Limited ('Weatherseal Fenestration'), Mr. Harish Munireddy and Ms. Pratibha SB and Weatherseal Fenestration. It is informed that the Company has, today, subscribed to 51% of the equity share capital of Weatherseal Fenestration comprising of 10,409 equity shares of Rs. 10 each at a premium of Rs. 18,091 per share, issued on preferential basis for an aggregate cash consideration of Rs. 18,84,13,309. Accordingly, Weatherseal Fenestration is now a subsidiary of the Company. The disclosures in terms of Regulation 30 of the Listing Regulations read with SEBI Circular No. CIR/CFD/CMD/4/2015 dated 9th September, 2015 has already been provided vide our aforementioned letter dated 1st April, 2022. This is for your information and record.

SUBJECT: Re-appointment
DETAILS: This is to inform you that the Board of Directors of the Company at their meeting held today, based on the recommendations of the Nomination and Remuneration Committee and the Audit Committee, have approved the re ￢ﾀﾓ appointment of Mr. Amit Syngle (DIN: 07232566) as the Managing Director & CEO of the Company for a further period of 5 (five) years with effect from 1st April, 2023 to 31st March, 2028, post completion of his present term on 31st March, 2023. The said re ￢ﾀﾓ appointment is subject to approval of the shareholders at the ensuing Annual General Meeting of the Company. The brief profile of Mr. Amit Syngle is available on the website on the Company at www.asianpaints.com. Mr. Amit Syngle is not related to any of the Directors and members of the Promoter(s)/Promoter(s) Group of the Company. To the best of our knowledge and information and as confirmed by Mr. Amit Syngle, he has not been debarred from holding the office as a Director of the Company, by virtue of an Order passed by the Securities and Exchange Board of India or any other authority.

SUBJECT: Dividend
DETAILS: The Board of Directors at their meeting held today have, inter alia, approved the following:Recommended payment of final dividend of Rs. 15.50 (Rupees fifteen and paise fifty only) per equity share of the face value of Re. 1 (Rupee one) each for the financial year ended 31 st March, 2022, subject to approval of the shareholders at the ensuing 76th Annual General Meeting. The total dividend for the financial year ended 31 st March, 2022, aggregates to Rs. 19. 15 (Rupees nineteen and paise fifteen only) per equity share of the face value of Re. 1 (Rupee one) each (dividend payout ratio of 58.6%), including the interim dividend of Rs. 3.65 (Rupees three and paise sixty five only) per equity share as approved by the Board of Directors at their meeting held on 21s t October, 2021, which was paid thereafter.The Company has fixed Friday, 10th June, 2022 as the Record Date for determining entitlement of members to final dividend for the financial year ended 31st March, 2022. The dividend, if approved by the shareholders will be paid on or after Friday, 1st July, 2022.

DETAILS: This is with reference to our letter no. APL/SEC/31/2022-23/01 dated 1st April, 2022, wherein it was informed that the Company has entered into a Share Purchase Agreement and other definitive documents (collectively referred to as ￢ﾀﾘDefinitive Documents￢ﾀﾙ) with the existing shareholders of Obgenix Software Private Limited (popularly known by the brand name of ￢ﾀﾘWhite Teak￢ﾀﾙ), for the acquisition of 100% of its equity share capital, in a staggered manner, over the period of next 3 (three) years, subject to certain conditions. SUBJECT: Cessation
DETAILS: This is to inform you that Mr. M K Sharma (DIN: 00327684) has ceased to be an Independent Director of the Company with effect from close of business hours on 31st March, 2022, upon completion of his tenure as an Independent Director in terms of Section 149 (11) of the Companies Act, 2013. The Board of Directors of the Company and the entire Asian Paints family places on record sincere appreciation for the outstanding contribution of Mr. M K Sharma during his tenure as an Independent Director of the Company. As the Chairman of the Audit Committee and member of the Nomination & Remuneration Committee, Mr. Sharma￢ﾀﾙs contribution has been immensely valuable and has further strengthened the Company￢ﾀﾙs governance standards. This is for your information and records.

SUBJECT: Closure of trading window
DETAILS: This is to inform you that as per "Asian Paints Limited - Code of Conduct to Regulate, Monitor and Report trading by Designated Persons" (hereinafter referred to as the "Code of Conduct"), the trading window of the Company will be closed from Wednesday, 23rd March, 2022 until 48 hours from the date of declaration of the audited financial results of the Company for the quarter and financial year ending 31st March, 2022. The details of the date of Board meeting and opening of the trading window shall be intimated in due course. The same is being informed to the Designated Persons in accordance with the Code of Conduct. This is for your information and record.

SUBJECT: Appointment
DETAILS: The Board of Directors of the Company at their meeting held today, based on the recommendation of the Nomination and Remuneration Committee and subject to approval of shareholders, have approved appointment of Ms. Nehal Vakil (DIN: 00165627) as Non-Executive Director of the Company, effective today, to fill casual vacancy created on the Board on account of the sad demise of Mr. Abhay Vakil, Non-Executive Director of the Company. The said appointment is in accordance with Articles of Association of the Company and other applicable provisions of Companies Act, 2013 and Listing Regulations. Ms. Nehal Vakil is daughter of Late Mr. Abhay Vakil, Non-Executive Director of the Company, and is member of Promoter(s) Group of the Company. To the best of our knowledge and information and as confirmed by Ms. Vakil, she has not been debarred from holding the office as a Director of the Company, by virtue of Order passed by SEBI or any other authority. The brief profile of Ms. Vakil is enclosed.

SUBJECT: General updates
DETAILS: This is with reference to our letter dated 24th February, 2021, wherein the Company had informed you that the Company￢ﾀﾙs RTA, TSR Darashaw Consultants Private Limited (TCPL) had shifted its Registered Office situated at Mahalaxmi, Mumbai to Vikhroli, Mumbai with effect from 1st March, 2021. It was also informed that for the convenience of the shareholders, TCPL would continue to service walk-in shareholders and receive documents from their office at Mahalaxmi, Mumbai for a limited period of time. In continuation of above, this is to inform you that TCPL will discontinue collection of documents at Mahalaxmi, Mumbai with effect from 1st March, 2022. Further, for the benefit and convenience of the shareholders, TCPL is setting up a new collection counter for submission of documents at the enclosed address with effect from 1st March, 2022. TCPL will continue to operate its investor service centres at Mumbai, New Delhi, Kolkata, Jamshedpur, Ahmedabad and Bangalore.

SUBJECT: Updates
DETAILS: Asian Paints Limited has informed the Exchange regarding 'This is with reference to our letter nos. APL/SEC/08/375 dated 23rd January, 2017 andAPL/SEC/08/2017   18/15 dated 25th July, 2017, wherein the Company had, inter alia, informedyou about its proposal to expand the existing manufacturing capacity of the Company smanufacturing facility situated at Ankleshwar, Gujarat.We inform you that the Company has today signed a Memorandum of Understanding with theGovernment of Gujarat, commencing the proposed expansion of manufacturing capacity of paintfrom 130,000 KL to 250,000 KL and resins and emulsions from 32000 MT to 85000MT to becompleted over a period of the next 2 -3 years at a total investment of Rs. 960 crores (approx.)on plant and machinery at the current prevailing prices. This expansion will be carried out on theexisting land owned by the Company.This is for your information and record.

SUBJECT: Dividend
DETAILS: The Board of Directors at their meeting held today have, inter alia, approved the following: i. Audited standalone and unaudited consolidated financial results of the Company for the quarter and half year ended 30th September, 2021; and ii. Payment of interim dividend of Rs. 3.65 (Rupees three and paise sixty five only) per equity share of the face value of Re. 1 (Rupee One) each for the financial year ending 31st March, 2022. Record date for the purpose of determining the entitlement of the shareholders for interim dividend has been fixed as Friday, 29th October 2021, and dividend will be paid to the shareholders on or after Wednesday, 10th November, 2021. Accordingly, the financial results along with the Press Release is enclosed. The Board meeting commenced at 10 a.m. and post approval of the aforesaid financial results will continue upto its scheduled time.

SUBJECT: Scheme of Arrangement
DETAILS: This is in continuation to our letter no. APL/SEC/20/223 dated 22nd January, 2020 wherein the Company had intimated of the Scheme of Amalgamation of Reno Chemicals Pharmaceuticals & Cosmetics Private Limited, wholly owned subsidiary of the Company, with Asian Paints Limited. In this regard, we wish to inform you that the Mumbai Bench of the National Company Law Tribunal, vide its Order dated 2nd September, 2021 received on 9th September, 2021, has granted its approval for the Scheme. The Appointed Date for the Scheme is 1st April, 2019 and it would be effective from the date of filing of the Order with the Registrar of Companies, Maharashtra at Mumbai. The details under Regulation 30 of the Listing Regulations read with Clause 1.2 of Annexure I of the SEBI Circular dated 9th September, 2015 have been submitted to the Stock Exchanges vide our earlier letter dated 22nd January, 2020.

Seshasayee is not related to any of the Directors or Key Managerial Personnel orPromoters of the Company.

DETAILS: Asian Paints Limited has informed the Exchange that Record date for the purpose of Dividend  is 11-Jun-2021.

SUBJECT: Dividend Updates
DETAILS: Asian Paints Limited has informed the Exchange that the Board of Directors of the Company at their meeting held today, have, inter alia, recommended payment of final dividend of Rs. 14.50 (Rupees fourteen and paise fifty only) per equity share of the face value of Re.1 (Rupee one) each for the financial year ended 31st March, 2021, subject to approval of the shareholders at the ensuing 75th Annual General Meeting (AGM).

SUBJECT: Financial Results Updates
DETAILS: The Board of Directors of the Company at their meeting held today, have, inter alia, approved the following:Financial Results 1. Audited Financial Results (standalone and consolidated) for the quarter and year ended 31st March, 2021. 2. Audited Financial Statements (standalone and consolidated) for the year ended 31st March, 2021.The Board Meeting commenced at 10.00 a.m. and concluded at 2.40 p.m.

SUBJECT: Outcome of Board Meeting
DETAILS: The Board of Directors of the Company at their meeting held today, have, inter alia, approved the following:Financial Results 1. Audited Financial Results (standalone and consolidated) for the quarter and year ended 31st March, 2021. 2. Audited Financial Statements (standalone and consolidated) for the year ended 31st March, 2021.Dividend 3. Recommended payment of final dividend of Rs. 14.50 (Rupees fourteen and paise fifty only) per equity share of the face value of Re.1 (Rupee one) each for the financial year ended 31st March, 2021, subject to approval of the shareholders at the ensuing 75th Annual General Meeting (AGM). 4. The Company has fixed Friday, 11th June, 2021 as the Record Date for determining entitlement of members to final dividend for the financial year ended 31st March, 2021. The dividend, if approved by the shareholders will be paid on or after Friday, 2nd July, 2021.Annual General Meeting  5. Convening of 75th AGM of the Company virtually on Tuesday, 29th June, 2021, at 11:00 a.m.Re-appointment of Statutory Auditors  6. Re-appointment of M/s. Deloitte Haskins & Sells LLP, Chartered Accountants (Firm Registration No. 117366W/W-100018), as the Statutory Auditors of the Company for a second term of five (5) years, subject to the approval of the shareholders at the ensuing AGM, to hold office from the conclusion of this 75th AGM till the conclusion of 80th AGM.The Board Meeting commenced at 10.00 a.m. and concluded at 2.40 p.m.

SUBJECT: Updates
DETAILS: Asian Paints Limited has informed the Exchange regarding 'This is with reference to our letter no. APL/SEC/2019-20/08/147 dated 23rd March, 2020, wherein the Company had informed of the disruption of operations across the country on account of the COVID -19 pandemic.It is now informed that, in accordance with the guidelines issued by the Ministry of Home Affairs, Government of India, and various State Government Authorities, the Company has partially resumed operations at some of its manufacturing locations, warehouses, and offices whereinlockdown restrictions have been eased. The operations at these locations will be carried out in accordance with the guidelines issued by the regulatory authorities, after obtaining permissions wherever required.The Company has taken all the required measures to ensure the safety of its employees at all locations in accordance with the guidance issued by the Central/State/Municipal authorities. The Company will continue to monitor the situation closely and take appropriate action as per regulatory guidelines.This is for your information and record.'.

SUBJECT: Change in Management
DETAILS: Asian Paints Limited has informed the Exchange that This is with reference to our letter no. APL/SEC/20/182 dated 22nd October, 2019 wherein it was, inter alia, informed that Mr. KBS Anand, Managing Director and CEO, will be retiring from the services of the Company w.e.f. 31st March, 2020. It was also informed that Mr. Amit Syngle, Chief Operating Officer, will succeed Mr. KBS Anand as the Managing Director & CEO with effect from 1st April, 2020. Brief profile of Mr. Amit Syngle was also attached along with the said intimation. The Board of Directors at their meeting conducted through video conferencing facility, today, based on the recommendations of the Nomination and Remuneration Committee and the Audit Committee of the Board of Directors, have approved the appointment of Mr. Amit Syngle (DIN: 07232566), as an Additional Director/Managing Director and CEO (Key Managerial Person) of the Company effective from 1st April, 2020 for a period of three (3) years upto 31st March 2023, subject to the approval of the Shareholders at the ensuing Annual General Meeting of the Company. The Board also approved the other terms and conditions including his remuneration.

SUBJECT: Change in Director(s)
DETAILS: Asian Paints Limited has informed the Exchange regarding Change in Director(s) of the company.

SUBJECT: Strikes/Lockouts/Disturbances
DETAILS: This is to inform that the Company has been taking a series of measures in view of the COVID-19 pandemic to ensure safety and health of all our employees and to ensure compliance with various directives being issued by Central/State/Municipal authorities.In view of the lockdown in many of the States across the country, the operations in most of our locations are disrupted. The operations in all the manufacturing and most of the sales locations, including Home Improvement and Industrial business, will be shut down in the next twenty-four (24) hours. All the employees in our offices have been instructed to work from home.The duration of this shutdown will depend upon directives to be further issued by the respective Government authorities in this regard. The Company will continue to closely monitor the situation and take appropriate action as per regulatory guidance.This is for your information and record.

SUBJECT: Amalgamation/Merger
DETAILS: Asian Paints Limited has informed the Exchange about Amalgamation/Merger Pursuant to Regulation 30 of the SEBI (Listing Obligations and Disclosure Requirements) Regulations, 2015 (Listing Regulations), we wish to inform you that the Board of Directors at their meeting held today, has inter alia, approved the Scheme of amalgamation of Reno Chemicals Pharmaceuticals & Cosmetics Private Limited ( Transferor Company ), wholly owned subsidiary of the Company with Asian Paints Limited ( Transferee Company ) in accordance with the provisions of Companies Act, 2013 and other applicable laws.The aforesaid amalgamation is subject to necessary statutory and regulatory approvals, including approval of the National Company Law Tribunal, Mumbai.The details required under Regulation 30 of the SEBI (Listing Obligations and Disclosure Requirements) Regulations, 2015 read with SEBI Circular No. CIR/CFD/CMD/4/2O15 dated 9th September, 2015 are enclosed.

SUBJECT: Updates
DETAILS: Asian Paints Limited has informed the Exchange regarding 'In compliance with Regulation 30 of the Securities and Exchange Board of India ( SEBI ) (Listing Obligations and Disclosure Requirements) Regulations 2015, this is to inform that Competition Commission of India, ( CCI ) has passed a prima facie order dated 14th January, 2020, directing the Director General to cause an investigation against the Company, under the provisions of Section 26(1) of the Competition Act, 2002, basis information received from JSW Paints Private Limited.The copy of the order is available on the website of CCI.The Company is currently examining the order and will take appropriate legal recourse and will extend full co-operation to CCI in the matter.'.

SUBJECT: Reply to Clarification Sought
DETAILS: ASIANPAINT: The Exchange had sought clarification from Asian Paints Limited with respect to announcement dated 08-Apr-2019, inter-alia stating that "a fire broke out at the Company's paint manufacturing facility in Vishakhapatnam, Andhra Pradesh, today in the afternoon. The fire has been brought under control. The Company is in the process of assessing the extent of damage. The manufacturing operations of the plant have been affected. This will not have any impact on the business operations of the Company". On basis of above the company was required to clarify following- 1. The actual amount of damage caused due to the natural calamity or other force majeure events; 2. Insurance amount claimed and realized by the listed entity for the loss/damage.The response of the Company is attached.

The fire has been brought under control. The Company is in the process of assessing the extent of damage. The manufacturing operations of the plant have been affected. SUBJECT: Change in Director(s)
DETAILS: Asian Paints Limited has informed the Exchange regarding Change in Director(s) of the company. The Board of Directors of the Company at their meeting held today, based on the recommendation of the Nomination & Remuneration Committee, approved the appointment of Mr. Manish Choksi (DIN: 00026496) as a Non ￂﾖ Executive Director, effective today, to fill the casual vacancy created on the Board on account of the sad demise of Mr. Ashwin Choksi, Non ￂﾖ Executive Chairman of the Company. The said appointment is in accordance with Section 152 and other application provisions of the Companies Act and Listing Regulations. Mr. Manish Choksi is the son of Mr. Mahendra Choksi, Non ￂﾖ Executive Director of the Company and forms part of the Promoter(s) & Promoter(s) Group of the Company.In view of above, Mr.  Manish Choksi has resigned from the services of the Company as President ￂﾖ International, IT, HR & Chemicals.In accordance with the circular issued by Stock Exchanges dated 20th June, 2018, we hereby confirm that Mr. Manish Choksi is not debarred from holding office of Director by virtue of any SEBI Order or any other such authority. The brief profile of Mr. Manish Choksi is attached.

SUBJECT: Reply to Clarification Sought
DETAILS: ASIANPAINT:The Exchange had sought clarification from the Company with respect to announcement dated June 21, 2016, regarding, vide letter dated June 21, 2016 that "This is with reference to our letter no. APL/SEC/08/262 dated 10th March, 2015 wherein the Company had informed you of its proposal of setting up a paints manufacturing plant in Vishakhapatnam District, Andhra Pradesh. This is to inform you that the Company has re-looked at its product portfolio to be manufactured at this proposed manufacturing plant and has decided to revise its plans of setting up of the plant with a maximum capacity of 5,00,000 kiloliters per annum, to be put up in phases. The approximate amount that would be invested by the Company in phases over a period of 12 years from the date of commencement of construction, including the cost of land, would be Rs. 1785 crores. None of the Promoters, Directors, Key Managerial Personnel or their relatives are directly / indirectly interested in the aforesaid proposal".On the basis of above, the Company have clarified that:1. Existing capacity - Not Applicable   since it is a proposed new manufacturing facility to be set up at Vishakhapatnam District, Andhra Pradesh;2. Existing capacity utilization   NA   refer to point 1 above;3. Period within which the proposed capacity is to be added; - NA   proposed new manufacturing facility;4. Mode of financing; - Internal accruals; and 5. Rationale.   To meet the demand for in the Southern and Eastern parts of the country, the Company is proposing to set up an integrated manufacturing facility in the state of Andhra Pradesh.

SUBJECT: Clarification
DETAILS: ASIANPAINT:The Exchange has sought clarification from Asian Paints Limited with respect to announcement dated June 21, 2016, regarding " Asian Paints Limited has informed the Exchange vide letter dated June 21, 2016 that "This is with reference to our letter no. APL/SEC/08/262 dated 10th March, 2015 wherein the Company had informed you of its proposal of setting up a paints manufacturing plant in Vishakhapatnam District, Andhra Pradesh. This is to inform you that the Company has re-looked at its product portfolio to be manufactured at this proposed manufacturing plant and has decided to revise its plans of setting up of the plant with a maximum capacity of 5,00,000 kiloliters per annum, to be put up in phases. The approximate amount that would be invested by the Company in phases over a period of 12 years from the date of commencement of construction, including the cost of land, would be Rs. 1785 crores. None of the Promoters, Directors, Key Managerial Personnel or their relatives are directly / indirectly interested in the aforesaid proposal".".On basis of above the Company is required to clarify following:1. Existing capacity;2. Existing capacity utilization;3. Period within which the proposed capacity is to be added;4. Mode of financing;5. Rationale.The response of the Company is awaited.

April 01, 2016.The Company had discovered certain irregularities at Sharepro Services, w.r.t. the share related operations and dividend encashment activities. After conducting preliminary internal investigations, the Company had filed a complaint with the Police department against Sharepro Services and its employees, for further investigation, which was converted into an FIR. The Company is in the process of evaluating other Registrar & Transfer Agents for a smooth transition and will make necessary disclosures on any development in this regard. SUBJECT: Updates

Further, the Ethiopian Investment Agency , Ethiopia ("EIA") has granted capital registration to Kadisco with respect to the investment made by BIL for the said Acquisition .

SUBJECT: Updates
DETAILS: Asian Paints Limited has informed the Exchange that further to the disclosures made by the Company wherein it was exploring the possibility of setting up a paint manufacturing plant and is in discussion with the Southern states of the country for the same, Company would like to inform the following :  To meet the demand in the Southern and Eastern parts of the country, the Company is exploring the possibility of setting up integrated paint manufacturing plants in the states of Karnataka and Andhra Pradesh. The Company is in the advanced stage of negotiations with the respective State Governments. Based on the availability of land, other factors and regulatory approvals , the Company will decide the location of the plant. The approximate investment at current prices for setting up a plant with a capacity of 6 (six) lakh KL p.a. would be Rs. 2300 crores over a period of 5 (five) to 7 (seven) years.

Rs. 117.6 crores) in cash. Certain regulatory approvals are pending from the governing authorities in Ethiopia in relation to the said Acquisition. Kadisco is one of the leading paint companies in Ethiopia and is engaged in the manufacturing and selling of decorative paints, industrial paints, automotive paints, other coatings and adhesives in Ethiopia".

Further steps to be taken for setting up the manufacturing plant with a capacity of 24,550 ton in Indonesia will be subject to necessary regulatory and other approvals.    Further, a second application for investment approval was made with Badan Koordinasi Penanaman Modal ("BKPM"), the Investment Coordinating Board of Republic of Indonesia, for incorporating a second company in Indonesia which will engage in import of finished goods including decorative paints, other coatings and related items for sale in Indonesia. BKPM has issued a principal license approving the said investment application.

DETAILS: The Exchange has sought clarification from Asian Paints Limited with respect to recent news item captioned "Asian Paints in talks for Rs. 2,500-cr project in south". In this regard, Exchange have advised the Company to provide clarification/confirmation on the news item in detail including the following: a) Whether such event/negotiations/article stated in published news were taking place? If so, you are advised to provide the said information along with the sequence of events in chronological order and the material impact of this article on the Company. b) Whether company are aware of any information that has not been announced to the Exchanges under clause 36 of the Listing Agreement. The response from the Company is awaited.

SUBJECT: Trading Window

The same is being informed to the Directors, persons belonging to the Promoter Group and Designated employees of the Company.

SUBJECT: Updates
DETAILS: Asian Paints Limited has informed the Exchange that the Company had informed that a letter was received from Shri Ashish Shah, Partner, M/s. Manubhai & Shah, Chartered Accountants (Formerly Partner of M/s. Shah & Co., Chartered Accountants) stating that M/s. Shah & Co., Chartered Accountants, Joint Statutory Auditor of the Company had merged with M/s. Manubhai & Shah, Chartered Accountants with effect from December 1, 2014. The letter also mentioned that on account of the aforesaid merger, M/s. Shah & Co. Chartered Accountants had ceased to exist as an entity under the regulations of the Institute of Chartered Accountants of India. Further, the Board of Directors of the Company, at their meeting held on December 20, 2014, on the recommendations of the Audit Committee, have decided that M/s. B S R & Co., LLP, Chartered Accountants, remaining Statutory Auditor of the Company shall continue to act as a sole Statutory Auditor till the conclusion of the next Annual General Meeting.

SUBJECT: Updates
DETAILS: Asian Paints Limited has informed the Exchange that the shareholders at the Annual General Meeting of the Company held on June 26, 2014 had appointed M/s. Shah & Co., Chartered Accountants and M/s. B S R & Co. LLP, Chartered Accountants as the Joint Statutory Auditors to hold office from the conclusion of Annual General Meeting to the conclusion of the next Annual General Meeting.  Further, that the Company has received a letter dated December 1, 2014 on December 4, 2014 from Shri Ashish Shah, Partner, M/s. Manubhai & Shah, Chartered Accountants (Formerly Partner of M/s. Shah & Co., Chartered Accountants) informing that M/s. Shah & Co., Chartered Accountants, has merged with M/s. Manubhai & Shah, Chartered Accountants with effect from December 1, 2014. The letter also states that on account of the aforesaid merger, M/s. Shah & Co. Chartered Accountants has ceased to exist as an entity under the regulations of the Institute of Chartered Accountants of India. The Audit Committee and the Board of Directors of the Company would take appropriate action in this regard in accordance with the provisions of the Companies Act, 2013 and other applicable laws.

SUBJECT: Acquisition
DETAILS: Asian Paints Limited has informed the Exchange that : "This is with reference to our letter no. APL/SEC/08/213 dated April 14, 2014, wherein the Company had informed that Asian Paints (International) Limited, Mauritius, ( APIL ) a wholly owned subsidiary of the Company, had signed an agreement with the shareholders of Kadisco Paint and Adhesive Industry Share Company (formerly known as Kadisco Chemical Industry PLC), Ethiopia ( Kadisco ) to acquire directly or indirectly though its subsidiaries, 51% of the equity share capital of Kadisco, subject to applicable regulatory and other approvals.   This is to further inform you that Berger International Limited, Singapore, a wholly owned subsidiary of APIL has today signed a Share Purchase Agreement and other definitive agreements and documents to acquire 51% stake in Kadisco (the Acquisition ). The Acquisition is subject to approval of the regulatory authorities in Ethiopia. The consideration for the Acquisition will be disclosed on closing and completion of the Acquisition. This Acquisition will enable the Company to expand its international footprint.   Kadisco is one of the leading paint companies in Ethiopia and is engaged in the manufacturing and selling of decorative paints, industrial paints, automotive paints, other coatings and adhesives in Ethiopia. None of the persons belonging to Promoter/ Promoter Group(s) of the Company has any interest in the Acquisition and it is not a related party transaction for the Company."

SUBJECT: Updates
DETAILS: Asian Paints Limited has informed the Exchange with reference to their letter dated August 22, 2014, wherein the Company had informed that Berger International Limited (BIL), Singapore, a subsidiary of Asian Paints (International) Limited (APIL), Mauritius, a wholly owned subsidiary of the Company, had on August 22, 2014 filed an application for investment approval with the Regulatory authorities at Jakarta, Indonesia for setting up a paint manufacturing facility as part of a greenfield foray into Indonesia. In this regard, this is to inform that Badan Koordinasi Penanaman Modal ( BKPM ), the Investment Coordinating Board of Republic of Indonesia, has approved the aforesaid investment application and has issued a principal license for setting up manufacturing facility. Further steps to be taken for setting up the greenfield operations in Indonesia will be subject to necessary regulatory and other approvals.

SUBJECT: Updates
DETAILS: Asian Paints Limited has informed the Exchange with reference to the earlier announcement dated February 13, 2014 wherein it was informed that Berger International Limited (BIL), Singapore, a subsidiary of Asian Paints (International) Limited (APIL), Mauritius, a wholly owned subsidiary of the Company, had been delisted from Singapore Exchange Securities Trading Limited (SGX ST) with effect from 11th February, 2014 and APIL held and owned approximately 96.69 per cent of the total number of issued shares of BIL. In this regard, this is to inform that the High Court of the Republic of Singapore had on 15th July, 2014 approved the proposal of selective capital reduction, under the Companies Act, of Singapore, to cancel all the shares held by the minority shareholders of BIL, effective upon the lodgment of the Order of Court approving the Selective Capital Reduction with the Registrar of Companies and Businesses (Registrar). BIL had on July 30, 2014 lodged the Order of the Court with the Registrar, resulting in BIL becoming a 100% subsidiary of APIL.

SUBJECT: Outcome of Board Meeting

Post the infusion, the Company would hold 51% stake in SIPL.The Company would further infuse a sum of Rs. 19.69 crores, on August 10, 2013, as a second tranche to this transaction by further subscription to equity shares of SIPL with a corresponding proportionate infusion by the existing promoters of SIPL. DETAILS: Asian Paints Limited has informed the Exchange that the Board of Directors of the Company at its meeting held on May 09, 2013 has approved the sub-division of each Equity share of the Company of the face value of Rs.10 each fully paid up into 10 (ten) shares of the face value of Re.1 each fully paid up, subject to the approval of the shareholders at the ensuing Annual General Meeting.

SUBJECT: AGM/Book Closure
DETAILS: Asian Paints Limited has informed the Exchange that the Register of Members & Share Transfer Books of the Company will remain closed from June 08, 2013 to June 24, 2013 (both days inclusive) for the purpose of Payment of Final Dividend & Annual General Meeting (AGM) of the Company to be held on June 24, 2013.

SUBJECT: Date of payment of dividend
DETAILS: Asian Paints Limited has informed the Exchange that the final dividend, if approved by the shareholders at the ensuing Annual General Meeting to be held on June 24, 2013 will be paid/despatched on or after June 25, 2013.

SUBJECT: Dividend
DETAILS: Asian Paints Limited has informed the Exchange that the Board of Directors of the Company at its meeting held on May 09, 2013 has recommended payment of final dividend of Rs. 36.50 (Rupees Thirty Six and Paise Fifty only) per Equity Share of the face value of Rs. 10 each for the financial year ended March 31, 2013. Together with the interim dividend of Rs. 9.50 (Rupees nine and paise fifty only) per Equity Share of the face value of Rs. 10 each approved by the Board on October 25, 2012, the total dividend aggregates to Rs. 46 (Rupees Forty Six only) per Equity Share of the value of Rs. 10 each for the financial year ended March 31, 2013.

SUBJECT: Financial Result Updates
DETAILS: Asian Paints Limited has submitted to the Exchange the Standalone and Consolidated Financial Results for the period ended March 31,2013.

SUBJECT: Updates
DETAILS: Asian Paints Limited has submitted to the Exchange a copy of the announcement made by Berger International Limited (BIL), Singapore, which is listed on the Singapore Stock Exchange Limited. BIL is an indirect subsidiary of the Company. The announcement has already been made on the Singapore Stock Exchange Limited on May 03, 2013 by BIL. Further BIL, Singapore, has no operations in India.

SUBJECT: Appointment of Director

SUBJECT: Updates
DETAILS: Asian Paints Limited has informed the Exchange that the Board of Directors of the Company at their meeting held on October 25, 2012 have approved, subject to the approval of the shareholders through Postal Ballot pursuant to Section 192A of the Companies Act, 1956 read with Companies (Passing of Resolution by Postal Ballot) Rules, 2011, the alteration of the Object Clause of the Memorandum of Association of the Company pursuant to Sections 16, 17,18, 149(2A) and other applicable provisions, if any, of the Companies Act, 1956 for considering the opportunities available in the area of Home Improvement & Decor. SUBJECT: Updates
DETAILS: Asian Paints Limited has informed the Exchange that (1) The Company has received the Certified Copy of the Order passed by the Hon'ble High Court of judicature at Bombay approving the Scheme of Merger and Demerger which envisages merger of PPG Coatings India Private Limited (subsidiary of PPG India) and AP Coatings Limited (wholly owned subsidiary of the Company) with Asian PPG Industries Limited (APPG) (existing Joint Venture between Asian Paints Group and PPG Group). The Scheme then provides for demerger of the Liquid Industrial Paints, Powder Coatings and Protective Coatings businesses from APPG into Asian Paints PPG Limited (second Joint Venture Company). The appointed date under the Scheme was April 01, 2012. SUBJECT: Updates
DETAILS: Asian Paints Limited had informed the Exchange regarding the withdrawal of the Composite Scheme for Merger and Demerger involving companies of Asian Paints Group, PPG Group and its Joint Venture Company, Asian PPG Industries Limited filed with the Hon'ble High Court of Judicature at Bombay and Hon'ble High Court of Judicature at Madras ("High Courts"). The Board at its meeting held on February 17, 2012 approved the Revised Composite Scheme for Merger and Demerger, under Section 391 to 394 of the Companies Act, 1956 and other applicable provisions whereby PPG Coatings India Private Limited (subsidiary of PPG in India) and AP Coatings Limited (wholly owned subsidiary of the Company) will merge with Asian PPG Industries Limited (APPG) (Joint Venture between Asian Paints Group and PPG Group). The Scheme then provides for the demerger of the Liquid Industrial Paints, Powder Coatings and Protective Coatings businesses from APPG into Asian Paints PPG Limited (second Joint Venture Company). The sanction of the said Composite Scheme is subject to the approval of the Hon'ble High Court of Judicature at Bombay and such other approvals as may be necessary.

SUBJECT: Updates
DETAILS: Asian Paints Limited has informed the Exchange that the Company have planned a shutdown of the Company's plant at Rohtak, Haryana from February 16, 2012 to March 15, 2012 in order that certain activities connected with the expansion of the plant can be carried out. The Plant is being expanded to 2,00,000 KL per annum. During the shutdown, new equipment will be commissioned and integrated with the existing systems. This shutdown will not affect the business of the Company as adequate build up of inventory has been made to cater to the expected demand.

SUBJECT: Updates
DETAILS: Asian Paints Limited has informed the Exchange with reference to the disclosure made by the Company on January 21, 2012 alongwith its audited financial results for the quarter and nine months ended December 31, 2011 relating to the withdrawal of the Composite Scheme for Merger and Demerger involving companies of Asian Paints Group, PPG Group and its Joint Venture Company, Asian PPG Industries Limited filed with the Hon'ble High Court of Judicature at Bombay and Hon'ble High Court of Judicature at Madras ("High Courts") in September, 2011, since PPG Industries Inc. USA had decided to restructure its operations in India prior to the proposed merger/demerger, Asian Paints Ltd has informed that the aforesaid Company Scheme Petitions have been allowed to be withdrawn by the respective High Courts. A revised Composite Scheme for Merger and Demerger encompassing, all businesses as originally envisaged will be filed in due course with the Hon'ble High Court of Judicature at Bombay.

SUBJECT: Updates
DETAILS: Asian Paints Limited has informed the Exchange that due to the severe cyclonic storm 'Thane' in Tamil Nadu, some equipment and materials at the Company's Penterythritol Plant, Cuddalore, Tamil Nadu have been damaged. The damage is being assessed by the Company. The operations at the Cuddalore Plant have been temporarily suspended. Penterythritol, an intermediate raw material, is being manufactured at the above Plant. All equipment and materials have been fully insured by the Company and the above will have no impact on the manufacturing of paints by the Company.

SUBJECT: Updates
DETAILS: Asian Paints Limited has informed the Exchange that the Company had announced on January 24, 2011 its plans to broaden and deepen the collaboration with PPG Industries lnc USA (PPG), one of the world's leading coatings and specialty products Company, to jointly accelerate growth of their non-decorative coatings businesses in India. As part of this arrangement, the Company and PPG have decided to expand their current 50-50 Joint Venture, Asian PPG Industries Limited (APPG), and also establish a second 50-50 Joint Venture Company. The Board held on September 21, 2011 approved the Composite Scheme for Merger and Demerger, under Section 391 to 394 of the Companies Act, 1956 and other applicable provisions whereby PPG India Private Limited, PPG Coatings India Private Limited (subsidiaries of PPG in India) and AP Coatings Limited (wholly owned subsidiary of the Company) will merge with APPG. The Scheme then provides for the demerger of the Liquid Industrial Paints, Powder Coatings and Protective Coatings businesses from APPG into the second Joint Venture Company- The sanction of the said Composite Scheme is subject to the approval of the Hon'ble High Court of Judicature at Madras, the Hon'ble High Court of Judicature at Bombay and such other approvals as may be necessary.

SUBJECT: Updates
DETAILS: Asian Paints Limited has informed the Exchange vide its letter dated April 12, 2010 that:"The Company's new paint plant at Rohtak in the State of Haryana has commenced  commercial production, today after the formal inauguration. The plant has an initial capacity of 150,000 KL per annum and can be scaled to 4,00,000 KL per annum in future expansions. This state-of-the-art facility has been commissioned on schedule. The plant has been set up at a project cost of approximately Rs. 500 crores (for the initial 1.5 lakh per annum KL capacity, including land).This plant has been built to very exacting and contemporary Environment, Health and Safety standards".

SUBJECT: Dividend/Others
DETAILS: Asian Paints Limited has informed the Exchange that: "The Board of Directors of the Company, in their meeting held today (May 10, 2007), have recommended the payment of final dividend of Re.1.00 (One rupee) per equity share of Rs.10/- each (10%) for the financial year ended 31st March, 2007. Together with the First interim dividend of Rs.5.50 per equity share (55%) approved by the Board on 30th October, 2006 and the second interim dividend of Rs.6.50 per equity share (65%) on 13th March, 2007, the total dividend aggregates to 130% for the financial year ended 31st March, 2007". Further, the final dividend, if approved by the shareholders, will be paid on or after 27th June, 2007.

SUBJECT: Publish Audited Results
DETAILS: Asian Paints Limited has informed the Exchange that: "the Company will publish the Audited Financial Results within three months of the completion of the Financial year April 2006 - March 2007 i.e., before 30th June 2007. Accordingly, the Unaudited Quarterly Financial Results are not being published as per Clause 41 of the listing Agreement".

SUBJECT: Acquisition
DETAILS: Asian Paints Limited has informed the Exchange that: "The consideration of Rs. 45 crores for acquiring a portion of ICI India's auto refinish business comprising of its advanced refinish range (2K) has been paid by Asian PPG Industries Limited and the balance consideration of Rs.7 crores would be paid in the next quarter, subject to certain agreed adjustments. Asian PPG Industries Limited is a 50:50 joint venture between Asian Paints Limited and PPG Industries Securities Inc., a wholly owned subsidiary of PPG Industries Inc., USA".

SUBJECT: Interim Dividend
DETAILS: Asian Paints Limited has informed the Exchange that "The board of Directors of the Company at their meeting held today, (i.e. March 13, 2007) have approved the payment of second interim dividend of Rs.6.50 per equity share of Rs.10/- each (65%) for the financial year ending 31st March, 2007. The Board of Directors have also approved 21st March, 2007 as the Record Date for the payment of second interim dividend to those members whose names appear on the Register of Members as on the said date". The Interim dividend will be paid to the shareholders on and from March 28, 2007.

SUBJECT: Agreement
DETAILS: Asian Paints Limited has informed the Exchange that : "PPG  Industries Inc., USA has signed a definitive agreement with ICI (India) Ltd as a result of which a portion of ICI India's auto refinish business comprising of its advanced refinish range (2K) will be acquired by Asian PPG Industries Ltd for a consideration of approximately Rs.52 crores, subject to certain agreed adjustments.  Asian PPG Industries Ltd is a 50:50 joint venture between Asian Paints Ltd and PPG Industries Inc., USA.  The 2K business of ICI India will be acquired as a going concern over the next few weeks.  It has about 60 employees and it had registered a sales revenue of around Rs.50 crores for the financial year ended 31st March, 2006."

SUBJECT: Commencement of commercial production
DETAILS: Asian Paints Limited has informed the Exchange on February 09, 2007 that "The new manufacturing plant of the Company situated at Taloja, Maharashtra to manufacture industrial coatings has commenced commercial production today. The plant has been established to manufacture industrial coatings with an initial capacity of 14,000 KL per annum".

SUBJECT: Sale of shares
DETAILS: Asian Paints Limited had informed the Exchange regarding Berger International Limited (BIL), an indirect subsidiary of the Company, executing a conditional Stock Purchase Agreement relating to the sale of 427,000 shares (representing the entire 30% share capital held by BIL), in the capital stock of Dutch Boy Philippines Inc. The company has now informed the Exchange that the said sale of shares has been completed on November 28,2006. With the disposal of the above shares, Dutch Boy Philippines, Inc., has ceased to be an associate company of BIL. The announcement made by BIL to the Singapore Stock Exchange in this regard is available on www.sgx.com.

SUBJECT: Share Purchase Agreement
DETAILS: Asian Paints Limited has informed the Exchange that Berger International Limited (BIL), a subsidiary of Asian Paints Limited (APL), has entered into a conditional share purchase agreement with Myanmar Economic Holdings Limited for the sale of its entire holding in Berger Paints Manufacturing Limited, Myanmar. Pursuant to the agreement, the consideration payable to BIL for the sale of said shares is US $ 600,000 (equivalent to approximately Singapore $ 936,420 based on an exchange rate of S $ 1.5607: US $ 1.00). The gain for the Berger group from the above transaction will be approximately S$ 0.725 million. Asian Paints (International) Limited, a 100% subsidiary Company of APL holds 50.1% shares of BIL. The above share purchase agreement is subject to requisite approvals as may be necessary.

SUBJECT: Commencement of production
DETAILS: Asian Paints India Ltd has informed the Exchange that the company's new paint plant at Sriperumbudur, near Chennai in the state of Tamil Nadu commenced production today after the formal inauguration. The plant is located in the SIPCOT(State Industrial Promotion Corporation of Tamilnadu)Industrial Park,Sriperumbudur about 30 kilometers from Chennai on the National Highway to Bangalore. The plant has been established to manufacture emulsion paints alone with an initial capacity of 30,000 KL per annum. The capacity will be raised in phases to 1,00,000 KL per annum.

SUBJECT: Outcome of Board Meeting
DETAILS: Asian Paints India Ltd has informed the Exchange that the BOD of the company in their meeting held on December 03, 2004, approved the following: 1) Disinvestment/transfer of shares held in Asian Paints (Mauritius) Limited, a subsidiary of Asian Paints (India) Limited to a local party, subject to necessary approvals and due diligence. The Company holds 89.6% of the equity of Asian Paints (Mauritius) Limited and has invested Rs.111.1 million till date. For the financial year ended March 31, 2004, the Company had made a provision of Rs.68 million towards diminution in value of investment in Asian Paints (Mauritius) Ltd; 2) Setting up a new plant at Taloja, Maharashtra for the manufacture of Industrial Liquid Paints. The first phase of the project with a capacity of 8000 KL would involve a capital expenditure of Rs.148.8 million.

SUBJECT: Outcome of Board Meeting
DETAILS: Asian Paints India Ltd has informed the Exchange that the BOD of the company in their meeting held on October 27, 2004, have approved 1) the payment of interim dividend of Rs.4.00 per equity share of Rs.10/- each (40%) for the FY ending March 31, 2005, and 2) November 02, 2004 as the Record Date for the payment of interim dividend. The interim dividend will be paid to the shareholders after November 05, 2004.

SUBJECT: Record Date
DETAILS: Asian Paints India Ltd has informed the Exchange that subject to the approval of the BoD's, the Company has announced November 02, 2004 as the Record date for the purpose of payment of interim dividend. The dividend, if approved by the BoD's, will be paid after November 05, 2004.

SUBJECT: News Verification
DETAILS: News Verification : The press had reports that Asian Paints India Ltd has put its chemical business on the block, as part of a restructuring exercise.The Exchange, in order to verify the accuracy or otherwise of the information reported in the press and to inform the market place so that the interest of the investors is safeguarded, had written to the officials of the company. Asian Paints India Ltd has vide its letter inter-alia stated, "The company wishes to place on record that at present the company is not in discussion with any organisation for the sale of the chemical business. Further, we would like to state that the capacities of the chemical business units comprising Phthalic Anhydride and Pentaerythritol have not been ramped up last year, as reported in the news item".
